result.execSummary:
The defendant Floyd J Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court will waive all non-mandatory costs and surcharges. Court ordrered mandatory surcharge to be paid at $15.00 a month commencing December 24, 2015 and the 24th thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment.
*Court ordered DNA surcharge after today's proceedings.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 1 (one) day, a Time Served Disposition.
*Court ordered 25 hours of community service at a church, neighborhood or helping others within the next three (3) months.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Floyd J Mitchell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 (one) day, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered 25 hours of community service at a church, neighborhood or helping others within the next three (3) months. 
Court will waive all non-mandatory costs and surcharges. Court ordrered mandatory surcharge to be paid at $15.00 a month commencing December 24, 2015 and the 24th thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment.

-Court ordered DNA surcharge after today's proceedings.
   
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Floyd J Mitchell in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Floyd J Mitchell in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Floyd J Mitchell in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/25/15 @ 1:30 pm
